00032 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00033 //  The implementation of blowfish for CBC mode is from
00034 //    http://www.thecodeproject.com/cpp/blowfish.asp by George Anescu
00035 //  I removed exception handling, so it is callers responsibility to insure
00036 //  that strings are length multiples of 8 bytes
00037 //  -mouser 1/08/05
00038 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00039 
00040 
00041 //
00042 //    BLOWFISH ENCRYPTION ALGORITHM
00043 //
00044 //    Implementation of Bruce Schneier's BLOWFISH algorithm from "Applied
00045 //    Cryptography", Second Edition.
00046 //
00047 //    Encryption and Decryption of Byte Strings using the Blowfish Encryption Algorithm.
00048 //    Blowfish is a block cipher that encrypts data in 8-byte blocks. The algorithm consists
00049 //    of two parts: a key-expansion part and a data-ancryption part. Key expansion converts a
00050 //    variable key of at least 1 and at most 56 bytes into several subkey arrays totaling
00051 //    4168 bytes. Blowfish has 16 rounds. Each round consists of a key-dependent permutation,
00052 //    and a key and data-dependent substitution. All operations are XORs and additions on 32-bit words.
00053 //    The only additional operations are four indexed array data lookups per round.
00054 //    Blowfish uses a large number of subkeys. These keys must be precomputed before any data
00055 //    encryption or decryption. The P-array consists of 18 32-bit subkeys: P0, P1,...,P17.
00056 //    There are also four 32-bit S-boxes with 256 entries each: S0,0, S0,1,...,S0,255;
00057 //    S1,0, S1,1,...,S1,255; S2,0, S2,1,...,S2,255; S3,0, S3,1,...,S3,255;
00058 //
00059 //    The Electronic Code Book (ECB), Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) and Cipher Feedback modes
00060 //    are used:
00061 //
00062 //    In ECB mode if the same block is encrypted twice with the same key, the resulting
00063 //    ciphertext blocks are the same.
00064 //
00065 //    In CBC Mode a ciphertext block is obtained by first xoring the
00066 //    plaintext block with the previous ciphertext block, and encrypting the resulting value.
00067 //
00068 //    In CFB mode a ciphertext block is obtained by encrypting the previous ciphertext block
00069 //    and xoring the resulting value with the plaintext
00070 //
00071 //    The previous ciphertext block is usually stored in an Initialization Vector (IV).
00072 //    An Initialization Vector of zero is commonly used for the first block, though other
00073 //    arrangements are also in use.
00074 //
00075 
00076 #include "kvi_settings.h"
00077 
00078 #if defined(COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT) || defined(Q_MOC_RUN)
00079 
00080 
00081 //Block Structure
00082 struct SBlock
00083 {
00084         //Constructors
00085         SBlock(unsigned int l=0, unsigned int r=0) : m_uil(l), m_uir(r) {}
00086         //Copy Constructor
00087         SBlock(const SBlock& roBlock) : m_uil(roBlock.m_uil), m_uir(roBlock.m_uir) {}
00088         SBlock& operator^=(SBlock& b) { m_uil ^= b.m_uil; m_uir ^= b.m_uir; return *this; }
00089         unsigned int m_uil, m_uir;
00090 };
00091 
00092 class BlowFish
00093 {
00094 public:
00095         enum { ECB=0, CBC=1, CFB=2 };
00096 
00097         //Constructor - Initialize the P and S boxes for a given Key
00098         BlowFish(unsigned char* ucKey, unsigned int n, const SBlock& roChain = SBlock(0UL,0UL));
00099 
00100         //Resetting the chaining block
00101         void ResetChain() { m_oChain = m_oChain0; }
00102 
00103         // Encrypt/Decrypt Buffer in Place
00104         void Encrypt(unsigned char* buf, unsigned int n, int iMode=ECB);
00105         void Decrypt(unsigned char* buf, unsigned int n, int iMode=ECB);
00106 
00107         // Encrypt/Decrypt from Input Buffer to Output Buffer
00108         void Encrypt(const unsigned char* in, unsigned char* out, unsigned int n, int iMode=ECB);
00109         void Decrypt(const unsigned char* in, unsigned char* out, unsigned int n, int iMode=ECB);
00110 
00111 //Private Functions
00112 private:
00113         unsigned int F(unsigned int ui);
00114         void Encrypt(SBlock&);
00115         void Decrypt(SBlock&);
00116 
00117 private:
00118         //The Initialization Vector, by default {0, 0}
00119         SBlock m_oChain0;
00120         SBlock m_oChain;
00121         unsigned int m_auiP[18];
00122         unsigned int m_auiS[4][256];
00123         static const unsigned int scm_auiInitP[18];
00124         static const unsigned int scm_auiInitS[4][256];
00125 };
00126 
00127 //Extract low order byte
00128 inline unsigned char Byte(unsigned int ui)
00129 {
00130         return (unsigned char)(ui & 0xff);
00131 }
00132 
00133 //Function F
00134 inline unsigned int BlowFish::F(unsigned int ui)
00135 {
00136         return ((m_auiS[0][Byte(ui>>24)] + m_auiS[1][Byte(ui>>16)]) ^ m_auiS[2][Byte(ui>>8)]) + m_auiS[3][Byte(ui)];
00137 }
